Shota Imanaga followed Matthew Boydâ€™s eight-inning gem with his own brilliant outing, twirling seven innings of one-run ball in a 4-1 victory over the Yankees on Sunday afternoon at Yankee Stadium. play-51 Game Recap play-52 Condensed Game Watch Archive carousel-arrow-right-124 Player of the Game Player of the Game Imanaga 7.0 IP, ER, 6 K, BB +22.9% WPA See Leaderboard arrow-next-4 Top Performers Imanaga W, 7.0 IP 2 H, 1 ER, 6 SO Swanson 2 - 4 HR, 2 RBI, R Stanton 1 - 3 HR, RBI, R Team Comparison R H HR TB SB LOB E Cubs 4 10 2 18 0 9 0 Yankees 1 2 1 5 0 0 0 Data Visualizations play-54 Michael Busch: Home Run Statcast Analysis 00:11 play-55 An animated look at Michael Busch's home run 00:11 play-56 Measuring the stats on Giancarlo Stanton's home run 00:12 play-57 Giancarlo Stanton's home run through bat tracking data 00:11 play-58 Breaking down Will Warren's pitches 00:04 carousel-arrow-right-76 More Coverage Cubs tab Wake Forest outfielder Conrad with 'a lot of upside' at No. 17 Yanks take Georgia high school standout SS Kilby with No. 39 pick Yankees look to regroup, find consistency after All-Star break Gil begins rehab assignment with strong outing Key Moments Scoring All Video Home Runs Strikeouts Hard Hit Balls Lead Changes Win Probability Swings Top 1st Bases. 1 - 0, 0 Outs Home Run Michael Busch homers (19) on a fly ball to center field.
